title: Conditional Sentences
description: If you study conditionals, you will ace this quiz! Explore the zero, first, second, and third conditionals.

questions.question: Which type of conditional expresses a general truth? 'If you heat water to 100Â°C, it boils.'

Which sentence is a correct second conditional?
options: If I win the lottery, I will buy a house.
If I win the lottery, I buy a house.
If I had won the lottery, I would have bought a house.

questions.question: Complete the third conditional: 'If she had studied harder, she ___ the exam.'
Which is a correct zero conditional sentence?
options: If you freeze water, it will turn to ice.
If you freeze water, it turns to ice.
If you had frozen water, it would have turned to ice.
If you froze water, it would turn to ice.

questions.question: In the second conditional, we use ___ in the 'if' clause.
Which sentence expresses an unlikely future event?
options: If I study, I will pass.
If I studied more, I would pass.
If I had studied, I would have passed.

questions.question: Complete: 'If I ___ you, I would apologize.'
Why do we say 'If I were' instead of 'If I was' in formal English?
options: It uses the subjunctive mood for unreal conditions

questions.question: Which conditional type is this? 'If you press this button, the light comes on.'

options: A conditional in the passive voice
A conditional that combines elements of different conditional types
